title: Examples
text: Lorem Ipum ..

title: Examples
text: render survey, pass JSON-compatible list surveyjs():
code: surveyjs(schema = list(   title = "JSON-based Example",   questions = list(     list(type = "text", name = "name", title = "Your name?")   ) ))

title: Examples
code: surveyjs(schema = list(   title = "Multi-Page Example",   pages = list(     list(name = "page1", elements = list(       list(type = "text", name = "first", title = "First name"),       list(type = "text", name = "last", title = "Last name")     )),     list(name = "page2", elements = list(       list(type = "rating", name = "satisfaction", title = "Satisfaction?")     ))   ) ))

title: Examples
text: surveyjs provides variety fully documented question types. useful question-type examples rsurveyjs just head question type examples.
code: surveyjs(schema = list(     title = "Question Types Example",     questions = list(       list(type = "text", name = "name", title = "Your name?"),       list(type = "rating", name = "satisfaction", title = "How was it?"),       list(         type = "dropdown",         name = "country",         title = "Select country",         choices = list("Germany", "France", "USA")       )     )   ))

title: Examples
text: Themes well documented Themes & Styles original surveyjs documentation. General speaking every theme comes light/dark version panel/panelless variant. convenience available themes referenced surveyjs_themes() within rsurveyjs.
code: surveyjs(   schema = list(     title = "Themed Survey",     questions = list(       list(type = "text", name = "name", title = "Name?"),       list(type = "rating", name = "rating", title = "Rate us")     )   ),   theme = "ThreeDimensionalLightPanelless"  # try: "contrast-dark", "flat-light", etc. )

title: Examples
text: can pass css variables style available themes via theme_vars argument.
code: surveyjs(   schema = list(     title = "Custom Theme Colors",     questions = list(       list(type = "rating", name = "rating", title = "How was it?")     )   ),   theme = "DefaultLightPanelless",   theme_vars = list(     "--sjs-primary-backcolor" = "rgba(0, 128, 255, 1)",        # Strong blue     "--sjs-primary-forecolor" = "#ffffff",                     # White text     "--sjs-border-default" = "rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)",              # Soft border     "--sjs-corner-radius" = "12px",                            # Rounded corners     "--sjs-shadow-medium" = "0 4px 12px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3)"     # Bigger shadow   ) )

title: Examples
text: Technical key-words like ‚ÄúComplete‚Äù get properly translated via locale argument.
code: surveyjs(   schema = list(     title = "Zufriedenheit",     pages = list(       list(name = "p1", elements = list(         list(type = "text", name = "name", title = "Ihr Name?"),         list(type = "rating", name = "satisfaction", title = "Zufrieden?")       ))     )   ),   locale = "fr"  # try "fr", "en", "es" )

title: Examples
text: Provide initial/default values rendering form load previously saved responses editing/updating.
code: surveyjs(   schema = list(     title = "Read-Only Preview",     questions = list(       list(type = "text", name = "name", title = "Your name?"),       list(type = "rating", name = "rating", title = "Rating?")     )   ),   data = list(name = "Taz", rating = 5) )

title: Examples
text: case just want display form input, make non-edible just provide readOnly = TRUE.
code: surveyjs(   schema = list(     title = "Read-Only Preview",     questions = list(       list(type = "text", name = "name", title = "Your name?"),       list(type = "rating", name = "rating", title = "Rating?")     )   ),   data = list(name = "Taz", rating = 5),   readOnly = TRUE )

title: Examples
text: can easily create forms quizzes.
code:
quiz_schema <- list( title = "Quick Quiz", showProgressBar = "top", showCorrectAnswers = "true", completedHtml = "

You scored {correctAnswers} out of {questionCount}.

", pages = list( list(elements = list( list( type = "radiogroup", name = "capital", title = "What is the capital of France?", choices = c("Berlin", "Madrid", "Paris", "Rome"), correctAnswer = "Paris" ), list( type = "radiogroup", name = "language", title = "Which language is mostly spoken in Brazil?", choices = c("Spanish", "Portuguese", "French"), correctAnswer = "Portuguese" ) )) ) ) surveyjs(quiz_schema)

title: Getting Started
text: render survey, pass JSON-compatible list surveyjs():
code: surveyjs(   schema = list(     title = "Feedback",     questions = list(       list(type = "rating", name = "satisfaction", title = "How satisfied are you?"),       list(type = "text", name = "comment", title = "Any comments?")     )   ) )

title: Getting Started
text: Use built-SurveyJS themes like "modern" "defaultV2":
code: surveyjs(   schema = list(     title = "Themed Survey",     questions = list(       list(type = "checkbox", name = "languages", title = "Which languages do you use?",            choices = c("R", "Python", "Julia"))     )   ),   theme = "modern" )

title: Getting Started
text: can override CSS variables using theme_vars:
code: surveyjs(   schema = list(     title = "Custom Theme",     questions = list(       list(type = "text", name = "name", title = "Your name")     )   ),   theme = "modern",   theme_vars = list("--sjs-primary-backcolor" = "#0072B2") )

title: Getting Started
text: Use locale switch languages (e.g., "de" German):
code: surveyjs(   schema = list(     title = "Ihre Meinung",     questions = list(       list(type = "rating", name = "zufriedenheit", title = "Wie zufrieden sind Sie?")     )   ),   locale = "de" )

title: Getting Started
text: Shiny apps, use live = TRUE receive updates continuously: Run shinyApp(ui, server).
code: ui <- fluidPage(   surveyjsOutput("mysurvey"),   verbatimTextOutput("out") )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   output$mysurvey <- renderSurveyjs({     surveyjs(       schema = list(         title = "Live feedback",         questions = list(           list(type = "text", name = "comment", title = "Your comment")         )       ),       live = TRUE     )   })    output$out <- renderPrint({     input$mysurvey_data_live   }) }

title: Live Updates and Dynamic Control
text: vignette demonstrates : - Enable live response tracking - Dynamically update SurveyJS widget new data settings

what: Example: Minimal App with Live Updates
title: Live Updates and Dynamic Control
code: ui <- fluidPage(   surveyjsOutput("mysurvey"),   verbatimTextOutput("live_output"),   actionButton("lock", "Set Readonly"),   actionButton("reload", "Replace Survey") )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    schema <- list(     title = "Feedback",     pages = list(list(       elements = list(         list(type = "text", name = "name", title = "What is your name?"),         list(type = "comment", name = "feedback", title = "Your feedback")       )     ))   )    output$mysurvey <- renderSurveyjs({     surveyjs(schema, live = TRUE)   })    output$live_output <- renderPrint({     input$mysurvey_data_live   })    observeEvent(input$lock, {     updateSurveyjs(session, "mysurvey", readOnly = TRUE)   })    observeEvent(input$reload, {     updateSurveyjs(session, "mysurvey", schema = list(       title = "New Survey",       pages = list(list(         elements = list(           list(type = "rating", name = "satisfaction", title = "Rate us")         )       ))     ))   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Live Updates and Dynamic Control
text: live = TRUE enables real-time tracking input$<id>_data_live Use updateSurveyjs() push updates server client

title: Live Updates and Dynamic Control
text: surveyjs() documentation SurveyJS JSON documentation

title: Survey Modes
text: SurveyJS (rsurveyjs) support several structural modes organizing questions pages. triggered different schema structures. modes supported natively SurveyJS passed rsurveyjs. can mix multiple modes together (e.g., panels inside multi-page surveys).

title: Survey Modes
text: Triggered schema contains top-level questions list.
code: surveyjs(schema = list(   title = "Single Page Survey",   questions = list(     list(type = "text", name = "email", title = "What is your email?")   ) ))

title: Survey Modes
text: Triggered schema uses pages instead questions.
code: surveyjs(schema = list(   title = "Multi Page Survey",   pages = list(     list(elements = list(list(type = "text", name = "first", title = "First name"))),     list(elements = list(list(type = "text", name = "last", title = "Last name")))   ) ))

title: Survey Modes
text: Uses type = ‚Äúpanel‚Äù logically group related questions.
code: surveyjs(schema = list(   title = "Panel Example",   questions = list(     list(       type = "panel",       name = "personal",       title = "Personal Info",       elements = list(         list(type = "text", name = "first", title = "First Name"),         list(type = "text", name = "last", title = "Last Name")       )     )   ) ))

title: Survey Modes
text: Uses type = ‚Äúpaneldynamic‚Äù create repeatable groups questions.
code: surveyjs(schema = list(   title = "Dynamic Panel",   questions = list(     list(       type = "paneldynamic",       name = "jobs",       title = "Previous Jobs",       templateElements = list(         list(type = "text", name = "employer", title = "Employer"),         list(type = "text", name = "role", title = "Role")       ),       panelCount = 1     )   ) ))

title: Survey Modes
text: Uses type = ‚Äúmatrix‚Äù display tabular inputs.
code: surveyjs(schema = list(   title = "Matrix Example",   questions = list(     list(       type = "matrix",       name = "satisfaction",       title = "Rate the following",       rows = list("Quality", "Speed"),       columns = list("Bad", "Okay", "Good")     )   ) ))

title: Survey Modes
text: Uses type = ‚Äúexpression‚Äù compute display calculated value.
code: surveyjs(schema = list(   title = "Expression Example",   questions = list(     list(type = "text", name = "a", title = "Enter a"),     list(type = "text", name = "b", title = "Enter b"),     list(type = "expression", name = "sum", title = "Sum", expression = "{a} + {b}")   ) ))

title: Survey Modes
text: Displays HTML images using type = ‚Äúhtml‚Äù type = ‚Äúimage‚Äù.
code: surveyjs(schema = list( title = "Static Content", questions = list( list(type = "html", name = "intro", html = "Welcome to the survey"), list(type = "image", name = "logo", imageLink = "https://via.placeholder.com/300x100") ) ))

title: SurveyJS Htmlwidget and Shiny Bindings
text: Minimal bindings SurveyJS v2.x R/Shiny. (See also.) rsurveyjs lets render interact fully customizable surveys, forms quizzes Shiny apps using SurveyJS v2.

title: SurveyJS Htmlwidget and Shiny Bindings
code: # Install from GitHub remotes::install_github("Tazinho/rsurveyjs")

title: SurveyJS Htmlwidget and Shiny Bindings
text: Integrates SurveyJS v2 R Supports Shiny input/output complete + live responses Customize via CSS variables using (theme_vars) Dynamically update widgets via updateSurveyjs() Supports readonly, initial values, multilingual forms

title: SurveyJS Htmlwidget and Shiny Bindings
code: library(rsurveyjs)  surveyjs(   schema = list(     title = "Feedback",     questions = list(       list(type = "rating", name = "s", title = "How satisfied are you?"),       list(type = "text", name = "c", title = "Any comments?")     )   ),   theme_vars = list("--sjs-primary-backcolor" = "#39f"),   locale = "en",   live = TRUE )

title: SurveyJS Htmlwidget and Shiny Bindings
text: SurveyJS Homepage Theme Customization Docs Release Notes

what: No Validation on the R Side
title: SurveyJS Htmlwidget and Shiny Bindings
text: rsurveyjs perform schema validation R. decision based fact SurveyJS already performs runtime validation browser. catches basic issues like malformed JSON unknown question types typically fails gracefully ‚Äî example, skipping invalid questions logging console warning. However, also SurveyJS enforce strict pre-validation: Invalid types like type = "foo" fail silently name required ‚Äî acts key survey result; without , answer saved. Invalid logic expressions may throw errors runtime unofficial JSON Schema exists, ‚Äôs actively maintained. Adding deep validation R introduce unnecessary complexity, dependencies, risk drift actual rendering engine. philosophy rsurveyjs keep things lightweight trust developer. something breaks, break render time ‚Äî just native SurveyJS project.

what: Only apply theme variables if the theme is valid
title: SurveyJS Htmlwidget and Shiny Bindings
text: intentionally apply custom theme_vars valid theme provided. means: specified theme invalid misspelled, survey falls back default visual style. case, theme_vars applied, since ‚Äôre assumed designed intended theme. avoids applying potentially mismatched styles helps keep behavior predictable.

title: Shiny bindings for the SurveyJS widget ‚Äî surveyjs-shiny
text: outputId Output variable read . width, height Size output container (CSS unit number). expr expression generates surveyjs widget. env environment evaluate expr. quoted expr quoted expression? (quote().)

title: SurveyJS widget for Shiny ‚Äî surveyjs
text: Render SurveyJS form JSON schema.

title: SurveyJS widget for Shiny ‚Äî surveyjs
code: surveyjs(   schema,   data = NULL,   readOnly = FALSE,   live = FALSE,   theme = "DefaultLight",   theme_vars = NULL,   locale = NULL,   width = NULL,   height = NULL,   elementId = NULL )

title: SurveyJS widget for Shiny ‚Äî surveyjs
text: schema List JSON string; must follow SurveyJS JSON Schema. data Optional named list initial values. readOnly Logical; render read-mode. live Logical; send live updates typing? Default FALSE. theme Theme, default "DefaultLight". theme_vars Optional named list CSS variables (e.g. --sjs-primary-backcolor). locale Optional language code (e.g. "en", "de"). See SurveyJS localization docs. width, height Optional CSS size number. elementId Optional element id container.

title: SurveyJS widget for Shiny ‚Äî surveyjs
text: Shiny widget (htmlwidget).

title: SurveyJS widget for Shiny ‚Äî surveyjs
text: widget renders fully customizable survey using SurveyJS v2 inside Shiny app. supports themes, read-mode, initial values, localization, real-time updates. Final answers delivered input[[paste0(id, "_data")]] user clicks Complete. live = TRUE, updates delivered input[[paste0(id, "_data_live")]] input.

what: Dynamically update a surveyjs() widget from the server side ‚Äî updateSurveyjs
title: Dynamically update a surveyjs() widget from the server side ‚Äî updateSurveyjs
text: function sends message existing SurveyJS widget rendered UI, allowing update data, read-mode, theme, locale, schema dynamically server using Shiny.

title: Dynamically update a surveyjs() widget from the server side ‚Äî updateSurveyjs
code: updateSurveyjs(   session,   id,   data = NULL,   readOnly = NULL,   schema = NULL,   theme = NULL,   locale = NULL )

title: Dynamically update a surveyjs() widget from the server side ‚Äî updateSurveyjs
text: session Shiny session object. id Output ID used surveyjsOutput(). data Optional named list answers set. readOnly Optional logical; toggle read-mode. schema Optional new schema (list JSON string). theme Optional theme name (e.g. "modern"). locale Optional locale code (e.g. "en", "de").

title: Dynamically update a surveyjs() widget from the server side ‚Äî updateSurveyjs

title: Version 0.1.0
text: SurveyJS v2 (React-based) Dynamic theming via CSS variables (theme_vars) Shiny integration (surveyjsOutput(), renderSurveyjs()) Server-side updates (updateSurveyjs()) Dependency-managed via htmlwidgets pkgdown-ready Dropped legacy SurveyJS v1 fallback simplify maintenance Added introductory vignette: ‚ÄúGetting Started‚Äù
